revised_title: Effects of Reagents on Colored Blood Corpuscles in Newts and Frogs
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on newt and frog blood corpuscles, observing their reactions to various reagents. They discovered that pyrogallic acid causes the corpuscles to change shape and eject a portion of their contents, while gallic acid dissolves the corpuscles' contents and leaves behind a bright yellow nucleus. These findings contribute to the understanding of blood chemistry and cellular biology.
